Fae Overview

üßö What are the Fae?

The Fae are ancient magical beings descended from the Sibling of Light from the Original Family. They are immortal creatures intrinsically connected to nature, magic, and the fundamental forces of creation and beauty. The Fae exist in a parallel realm that occasionally intersects with the mortal world.

Neither fully benevolent nor malevolent, the Fae operate by their own complex moral codes and ancient laws. They are creatures of extreme emotion, capable of great kindness and terrible cruelty, often within moments of each other.

‚ú® Nature of Fae Existence

Fae beings exist on multiple planes simultaneously, with their primary essence residing in the Otherworld while projecting portions of themselves into the mortal realm. This dual existence grants them incredible power but also binds them to ancient laws and natural cycles.

üåø Connection to Nature

Every Fae is bound to some aspect of the natural world - from individual trees to entire seasons, from specific emotions to abstract concepts like joy or sorrow. This connection grants them power but also creates vulnerabilities when their bound element is threatened or destroyed.

üé≠ Personality and Behavior

Fae are creatures of pure emotion and instinct, lacking the moral constraints that govern other species. They are intensely curious about mortals but often fail to understand human motivations or limitations. Their actions are guided by alien logic that values beauty, art, and emotional intensity above practical concerns.

Fae Abilities

‚ú® Glamour Magic

Illusion Weaving

Can create complex illusions that affect all senses, making the impossible seem real. Master glamourists can fool even magical detection.

Appearance Shifting

Can alter their appearance at will, from subtle changes to complete transformation into other beings or objects.

Memory Manipulation

Can implant false memories, erase experiences, or alter recollections to suit their purposes.

Emotional Glamour

Can manipulate emotions, making targets feel overwhelming love, fear, joy, or despair.

üåø Nature Magic

Plant Control

Command over all plant life, from making flowers bloom instantly to controlling ancient forests.

Weather Manipulation

Can influence weather patterns, summon storms, or create perfect sunny days.

Animal Communication

Can speak with and command all natural creatures, from insects to great beasts.

Elemental Mastery

Control over natural elements - earth, air, fire, and water - in their pure forms.

üéØ Supernatural Powers

Dimensional Travel

Can step between the mortal world and the Otherworld at will, using natural portals or creating temporary gateways.

Time Perception

Can dilate or compress time in localized areas, making minutes feel like hours or days pass in seconds.

Truth Sight

Can see through all deceptions, illusions, and lies, perceiving the true nature of people and situations.

Blessing and Cursing

Can bestow powerful blessings or terrible curses that last for generations.

The Fae Courts

üåû The Seelie Court (Summer Court)

Nature and Philosophy

The Seelie Court represents growth, life, light, and joy. They are generally more benevolent toward mortals but can be terrifyingly alien in their kindness.

Powers and Domains

  • Growth and fertility magic
  • Healing and restoration
  • Light and warmth manipulation
  • Joy and celebration induction

Notable Members

  • Queen Titania: Ruler of the Summer Court
  • Lord Oberon: King of the Seelie Fae
  • The Wild Hunt Leaders: Noble hunters of the court

üåö The Unseelie Court (Winter Court)

Nature and Philosophy

The Unseelie Court embodies endings, death, darkness, and sorrow. They are not evil but represent necessary aspects of existence that mortals fear.

Powers and Domains

  • Decay and entropy magic
  • Fear and nightmare creation
  • Ice and cold manipulation
  • Death and ending rituals

Notable Members

  • Queen Mab: The Winter Queen
  • The Erlking: Lord of the Wild Hunt
  • Leanansidhe: Queen's Lieutenant

üåø The Wyld Court (Neutral Court)

Nature and Philosophy

The Wyld Court represents pure, untamed nature and magic. They are the most unpredictable and dangerous of all Fae, bound by no laws except those of nature itself.

Powers and Domains

  • Primal magic manipulation
  • Shapeshifting mastery
  • Reality bending
  • Chaos and change induction

Notable Members

  • The Green Man: Avatar of wild nature
  • Puck: Trickster spirit
  • The Dullahan: Headless horseman

Fae Weaknesses

üîó Binding Weaknesses

Iron and Cold Iron

All forms of iron are toxic to Fae. Cold iron (never heated) can kill them outright. Even proximity to iron causes pain and weakness.

True Names

Knowing a Fae's true name grants absolute power over them. They guard these names jealously and will kill to protect them.

Broken Oaths

Fae cannot break their word once given. A broken oath causes them to fade from existence or transforms them into lesser beings.

‚ö° Natural Limitations

Invitation Requirements

Cannot enter mortal dwellings or sacred spaces without invitation. However, they are masters at tricking mortals into providing invitations.

Compulsive Behavior

Must count scattered seeds, untangle knots, or complete other compulsive actions when presented with them.

Running Water

Cannot cross running water without assistance. Rivers and streams form natural barriers against Fae incursions.

üéØ Circumstantial Weaknesses

Bound Element Destruction

Damaging or destroying their bound natural element weakens them significantly.

Court Politics

Bound by complex court politics and ancient rivalries that can be exploited by clever opponents.

Mortal Logic

Their alien mindset makes them vulnerable to simple, direct human reasoning and emotions.

Fae Lore and History

üåü Origins in Light

The Fae trace their origins to the Sibling of Light from the Original Family. When the Sibling of Light transcended physical form, their essence scattered across the natural world, giving birth to the first Fae in locations of great beauty and power.

üï∞Ô∏è Historical Timeline

üåÖ The First Dawning (Primordial Era)

The Sibling of Light creates the first Fae from sunbeams, starlight, and the laughter of children. The Otherworld is established as their primary realm.

üëë The Court Wars (Ancient Times)

The great division occurs, creating the Seelie and Unseelie Courts. The Wyld Court emerges as neutral arbiters. Thousands of years of conflict shape Fae society.

üèõÔ∏è The Compact Era (Classical Period)

Fae establish formal treaties with early human civilizations. Many mythologies and folklore traditions originate from these interactions.

üåô The Great Withdrawal (Medieval Period)

As iron becomes prevalent and Christianity spreads, Fae withdraw from direct interaction with mortals, operating through intermediaries and rare appearances.

üîÆ The Modern Resurgence (Contemporary Era)

Climate change and environmental destruction force Fae to take more active roles in world affairs. New compact with magical community established.

üè∞ The Otherworld

The Fae homeland exists parallel to the mortal world, accessible through natural gateways that appear at places of power - stone circles, ancient groves, crossroads at midnight. Time flows differently there, and the landscape shifts according to the collective will and emotions of its inhabitants.

üó∫Ô∏è Notable Locations

  • The Crystal Palace: Seelie Court's seat of power
  • The Bone Tower: Unseelie Court's dark fortress
  • The Wyld Wood: Untamed forest where rules don't apply
  • The Dreaming Gardens: Where mortal dreams take physical form
  • The Memory Lake: Contains all forgotten experiences

ü§ù Relations with Other Species

üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Sorcerers

Status: Complex Alliance

Fae and sorcerers have ancient treaties governing interaction. Some sorcerers serve Fae courts as mortal agents.

üëπ Demons

Status: Natural Enemies

Demons represent corruption and chaos, anathema to Fae who embody natural order and beauty.

üê∫ Werewolves

Status: Natural Allies

Shared connection to nature creates understanding between Fae and werewolves. Some packs serve as Fae guardians.

üßõ Vampires

Status: Cautious Respect

Vampires' immortality intrigues Fae, but their predatory nature conflicts with Fae values of beauty and growth.

üîÆ Modern Fae Society

Contemporary Fae have adapted to the modern world while maintaining their ancient ways. They influence environmental movements, inspire artists, and guide the development of renewable energy. However, they remain fundamentally alien to human understanding.

  • Environmental Activism: Fae subtly guide climate protection efforts
  • Artistic Inspiration: Many famous artists are unknowingly influenced by Fae
  • Technological Integration: Some Fae have learned to work with electronics and digital media
  • Urban Adaptation: City Fae bind themselves to parks, gardens, and green spaces

Playing as Fae

üéÆ Character Creation

Playing a Fae character offers unique roleplaying opportunities but requires understanding their alien mindset and natural limitations. Fae characters are powerful but bound by ancient laws and compulsions.

üëë Choose Your Court

Seelie (Summer)

Benevolent but alien. Focus on growth, healing, and protection. Can be terrifyingly helpful.

Unseelie (Winter)

Dark but not evil. Masters of fear, endings, and necessary cruelties. Honest in their malevolence.

Wyld (Neutral)

Unpredictable and primal. Most powerful but least controlled. Embody pure change and chaos.

üåø Bound Element

Choose what aspect of nature your Fae is bound to:

  • Seasonal: Spring growth, summer heat, autumn harvest, winter rest
  • Elemental: Earth stability, air freedom, fire passion, water flow
  • Emotional: Joy, sorrow, fear, love, anger, wonder
  • Conceptual: Dreams, memories, music, stories, time
  • Geographic: Specific forests, lakes, mountains, or sacred sites

üé≠ Roleplay Guidelines

  • Alien Logic: Think in terms of beauty, emotion, and natural law rather than human practicality
  • Oath Binding: Never make promises lightly - your word is literally your bond
  • Curiosity: Be intensely curious about mortals and their strange ways
  • Emotional Intensity: Feel everything deeply and act on pure emotion
  • Ancient Perspective: Remember you've existed for millennia - current events are just temporary

‚ö° Powers and Limitations

Glamour Mastery

Create illusions, alter appearance, manipulate memories and emotions.

Iron Vulnerability

Cannot touch iron. Proximity causes pain. Cold iron can kill you.

Nature Command

Control plants, animals, weather, and natural forces within your domain.

Compulsions

Must count scattered objects, cannot resist certain challenges or requests.

üåü Gameplay Mechanics

  • Favor Economy: Trade favors and debts rather than money
  • Oath Tracking: Keep careful record of all promises made and received
  • Seasonal Influence: Powers wax and wane with natural cycles
  • Court Politics: Navigate complex relationships with other Fae
  • Mortal Fascination: Seek to understand and collect interesting humans
